"The current build number: "The URL where the results of this build can be found (e.g. ``http://localhost:8080/job/MyJobName/1337/``)"
"The name of the node the current build is running on. Equals ``master`` for master node."
"Name of the project of this build. This is the name you gave your job when you first set it up. It's the third column of the Jenkins Dashboard main page."
"String of ``jenkins-${JOB_NAME}-${BUILD_NUMBER}``. Convenient to put into a resource file
"Set to the URL of the Jenkins master that's running the build. This value is used by Jenkins CLI for example"
"The unique number that identifies the current executor (among executors of the same machine) that's carrying out this build. This is the number you see in the 'build executor status'
such as '153'": except that the number starts from 0

"The current build number: "If your job is configured to use a specific JDK
such as '153'": this variable is set to the ``JAVA_HOME`` of the specified JDK. When this variable is set
this variable contains the revision number of the module. If you have more than one module specified
this variable contains the branch of the module. If CVS is configured to check out the trunk
column4: this environment variable will not be set."

such as '153'": this variable contains the Git hash of the commit checked out for the build (like ``ce9a3c1404e8c91be604088670e93434c4253f03``) (all the ``GIT_*`` variables require git plugin)"
this variable contains the Git url (like ``git@github.com:user/repo.git`` or ``https://github.com/user/repo.git``)"
this variable contains the Git branch that was checked out for the build (normally ``origin/master``)"
